Yes, managing your sugar intake while eating out or at a friend's place can be challenging, but there are some strategies you can use to make healthier choices:

1. Research the menu beforehand: If you know where you will be eating, check the menu online ahead of time to find healthier options that are low in added sugars.

2. Ask for modifications: Don't be afraid to ask the server for modifications when ordering. For example, you can ask for dressings and sauces on the side, and substitute sugary drinks for water or unsweetened beverages.

3. Share your meals: If the portions are large or if the dishes are high in calories and added sugars, consider sharing your meal with someone else.

4. Choose healthier options: Look for menu items that are grilled, steamed, or roasted rather than fried. Choose options with vegetables and lean protein rather than those high in added sugars and unhealthy fats.

5. Set limits and practice moderation: Treat yourself to an indulgent meal or dessert once in a while, but try to limit your portion sizes and frequency of indulgences.

6. Bring your own snacks: If you'll be at a friend's place or party, consider bringing your own healthier snacks like carrot sticks, hummus, or nuts and dried fruits.

Remember, the key is to be mindful of what you are eating and make conscious choices to manage your sugar intake, even when you're not in control of the menu.
